intro: Ammi pauciradiatum, commonly known as the Mexican thistle, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small white flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative means. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is sometimes considered a weed.
